subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Unicode Status
msgSnippet: ... It took me seven years and a lot of work to disunify Coptic from Greek. [hyperbole omitted] ... No, but there s no evidence that Shavian and Quikscript
messageBody:
On 16 Apr 2013, at 21:21, BPJ <bpj@...> wrote:

> 2013-04-16 17:54, Michael Everson skrev:
> > You will, orthographically. But I can't say that I believe that there is any chance whatsoever that the UCS will have both Shavian and Quikscript as two separate scripts.
>
> Meaning they have learnt nothing from the Coptic affair!

It took me seven years and a lot of work to disunify Coptic from Greek.

[hyperbole omitted]

> Are they running out of codepoints, or what?

No, but there's no evidence that Shavian and Quikscript have diverged and are different scripts. Quikscript looks like cursive Shavian with some additions. And that's because that's what it is. The cursivity and additions, in fact, were devised by the inventor of Shavian.

Perhaps you should be consider Shavian as blackletter to your more modern Quikscript. THe difference from Latin is that some people are still happy to use Shavian as their main script.

Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com/
